workspace.name: MLW2-Ingestion&Query
workspace.query:
(:LSQT - Last Stable Query Time - more later in workspace #4 Used in conjunction with temporal.setStatementSystemTime()
DO NOT need this if no need to set your own system time!
expect: empty sequence :)
temporal:set-use-lsqt("myTemporal",fn:true())

(: cts:period(t) => [t,t+dt) dt is the smallest time unit cts:period(t1,t2) => [t1,t2) study difference between ISO_CONTAINS & ALN_CONTAINS, ISO_OVERLAPS & ALN_OVERLAPS experiment with different axis/operator/period for operator defs : http://docs.marklogic.com/guide/temporal/searching#id_78584 :)
cts:search( fn:doc(), cts:period-range-query( "myValid", (: axis name :) "ISO_CONTAINS", (: operator name :) cts:period(xs:dateTime("2002-01-01T00:00:00Z"),xs:dateTime("2003-01-01T00:00:00Z"))) (:cts:period(xs:dateTime("9999-12-31T23:59:59Z")):) )

(:Fiona buys house 2001 recorded 2002 - lag Finn buys house 2004 recorded 2005 Fiona actually bought house 2000 recorded 2007 - correction Finn actually bought house 2003 recorded 2008 - correction QUIZ : Finn then sold house to Jake 2007 recorded 2009? QUIZ : Finn actually bought house 2005 recorded 2010?:)
(: PUT YOUR CODE HERE :)

(: who did we think owned the house mid-2000 as of 2005 ? who did we think owned the house mid-2000 as of 2010 ? who did we think owned the house 2002 as of 2010 ? who did we think owned the house 2007 as of 2010 ? what is the difference when you change ISO to ALN ? :) cts:search( fn:doc(), cts:and-query(( cts:period-range-query( "mySystem","ISO_CONTAINS", cts:period(xs:dateTime("????-??-01T00:00:00Z"))), cts:period-range-query( "myValid","ISO_CONTAINS", cts:period(xs:dateTime("????-??-01T00:00:00Z"))) )))

(: this exercise is about collections and bitemporal Write query to find all documents not in temporal collection and latest temporal documents use case: query database without historical versions :) cts:search(fn:doc(),cts:or-query(( cts:collection-query("????"), cts:not-query(cts:collection-query("????")) )))

(: in 2015, you found out everything you knew was wrong :)
(: check the content of "addr.json", what changed? what does it mean? which collections does "addr.json" belong to? Is it still latest? :)
temporal:document-delete("myTemporal","addr.json")
import module namespace temporal = "http://marklogic.com/xdmp/temporal" at "/MarkLogic/temporal.xqy"; (: "updates-safe" or "updates-admin-override"? :) temporal:collection-get-options("myTemporal")

(: you should get an error if "updates-safe" For regulated industries, absolutely NO non-temporal APIs can be used on temporal versions To disable this, change option with the next tab, then admin users can modify temporal versions:)
xdmp:document-insert("addr.json",object-node{"foo":"bar"})

import module namespace temporal = "http://marklogic.com/xdmp/temporal" at "/MarkLogic/temporal.xqy"; (: "updates-safe" or "updates-admin-override" :) temporal:collection-set-options("myTemporal","updates-admin-override")
